snippet: Soldiers and the police blocked roads to a neighborhood of tens of thousands of people in Monrovia, Liberia’s capital, and residents hurled rocks and stormed barricades trying to break out.
abstract: Violent clashes erupt between Liberian soldiers and residents as Liberia imposes quarantine in effort to curb spread of Ebola virus, which continues to spread in West Africa at alarming pace; Centers for Disease Control and Prevention says number of cases reported in affected nations--Guinea, Liberia, Nigeria and Sierra Leone--is already higher than in all other Ebola outbreaks combined since 1976.

byline.contributor: Clair MacDougall contributed reporting from Monrovia, and Sheri Fink from New York.

lead_paragraph: Soldiers and the police blocked roads to a neighborhood of tens of thousands of people in Monrovia, Liberia’s capital, and residents hurled rocks and stormed barricades trying to break out.

headline.main: Clashes Erupt as Liberia Sets an Ebola Quarantine
headline.print_headline: Clashes Erupt as Liberia Sets a Quarantine
